Bundesbank, the.translation[0].definitio: the national bank of Germany. It has a lot of influence in the European system of central banks. In the past, before the Euro became the currency  in Germany, the bank's decisions about rates of interest (=the additional amount you have to pay back when you borrow money) had a lot of influence on interest rates in other European countries.
Bundesbank, the.translation[1].definitio: The Bundesbank has announced increases in its discount and Lombard rates.
